availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles D. Schell (Clark County, IN / Jeffersonville. city watchman + justice of the peace )

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, city watchman. Maryland native. Married to Cornelia Beatty Schell. Father of Eugene M. Schell, H. C. Schell, Rucious M. Schell, Pinkney C. Schell, Charles Schell, Everett Schell, Enos T. Schell, Alvin Schell, and Anna Schell. Barkeeper in Jeffersonville, Indiana, in 1850. City watchman in Jeffersonville in 1860. Justice of the peace in Clark County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 178A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 352.
Indiana Death Certificates, 1899-2011, Indiana State Board of Health, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, IN, File #22790.
Pennsylvania, Pittsburgh City Deaths, 1870-1905, City of Pittsburgh Death Records, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, Roll #0505845 (004672718), p. 520.
KYR-0001-022-0011.
